captions.text: It has everything you could want.
You guys look like you have a beautiful life around here.
I love the diversity of the city.
There's so many different cultures and many different people from all over the world here.
Firstly I'm going to say the food. Secondly I'll probably go with the food.
But I love the, sort of, artistic spirit here.
Every time I'm here there's new cultural activity and beautiful museum exhibits.
More than anything I love the fans that we've met here in Toronto.
I mean there are fans really literally wrapping around the block. I've never experienced anything like that.
People in Toronto - this community loves film. I mean, really loves film.
You guys are enthusiastic - that's so nice.
It's really nice out there; the people have been really cool.
This city has always been so great to me. It's what makes us want to come here.
So it feels like a little bit of a home away from home for us.
It's really nice to be home.

title: A Home Away from Home: Celebrities at TIFF Talk Toronto

comments.text:
I miss you Toronto! It truly is one of the best cities in the world. I'm 
proud and blessed to have spent so much of my life there. Hopefully, I'll 
be back there soon/ And just like a good friend, we can pick up where we 
left off!﻿

comments.text:
So many fond memories of traveling there on my parents' boats.  Slightly 
more cosmo than Cleveland, my hometown.  Go if you haven't been.﻿
comments.author: Craig Persopoulos

comments.text:
LOL! The food is good, sure, but the people here are snobs to varying 
degrees. Many would refute this because they simply don't know any 
different. Spending time in other parts of the world you see that Toronto 
people are kind and courteous, but if you were being mugged, theyd rather 
not get involved.

Not the people that have been here for generations, but the new/current 
generation have this sense of entitlement and that they're particularly 
great, but for no specific reason, aside from their parents telling them 
so. There are no jobs outside of retail and service, and few work hard yet 
expect everything. Not saying everywhere else is perfect by any means, but 
Toronto is a very pretentious and hollow city.﻿
comments.author: venomchris
